name: Mount Lofty
directions: This system has several trails with different trail-heads on the South East Free-way, or near Waterfall Gully. From the city drive along Glen Osmond Road or Green Hill Road. Depending on the trail, the drive is 10 to 20 km.

name: Wild Goose State Trail
directions: Fond du Lac: The northern trailhead is located at Rolling Meadows Drive. Parking is available. Restrooms are available at the Rolling Meadows Golf Course near the trail.
description: This 34-mile rail trail skirts the western edge of the vast Horicon Marsh from Fond du Lac to Clyman Junction. The Horicon Marsh, a National Wildlife Refuge and State Wildlife Area, home to over 250 bird species, is world-famous for its numerous migrant waterfowl and endless V-shaped formations of Canada geese. Wildflowers, woodlots, wildlife, prairie remnants and fertile farm fields are common sites along the trail.

name: San Rafael State Natural Area
directions: Stay on I-10 E from Tuscon and follow AZ 82 W onto Taylor Ave. Take a left onto Harshaw Rd, then a slight right onto Harshaw Creek Rd. Turn right again toward San Rafael Valley Rd for 2.7 miles to the park.
description: Park is currently NOT open to the public.

name: Monagas
directions: This single track / trail network is in the Santa Ana Forest in BayamÃ³n, Puerto Rico. These lands were once part of Fort Buchanan Military Base and where later on given to the local government. Better known as Julio E. Monagas Park.

name: Quarry Trail (Dinosaur)
directions: Park at Rock Quarry park just off Stadium Blvd at the curve in the road near Durham Regional Hospital. From I-85, take Duke Street north and turn right onto Stadium drive. Parking area is less than 1/2 mile on the right.

name: Lake Ouachita
directions: From Hot Springs, AR, 13 miles, west on Highway 270 and north on Highway 227

directions: drive/ ride to the church in thredbo.
